message:
Agreed!

build it just in time, not just in case. This is a quote from the CEO of Intuit a few years ago.
I'm going to circulate this at work.

Software always has been, and should be disruptive. If it doesn't facilitate, enhance and transform communications and hence organisational structure it's not doing its job. Clients and suppliers both need to recognise this from the outset.

Like the cobbler, whose children go without shoes, the makers of software are not necessarily good at looking after themselves and their own agility puts limits on what they can deliver.
